title: Tame Impala Announces World Tour
body: Tame Impala announced a new world tour. Global distribution rights for their catalogue are managed directly by their distribution partner.

title: Music Publishing Rights
body: Publishing rights cover the underlying composition. Taylor Swift's re-recordings highlight the importance of artists controlling their master rights.

title: Digital Music Distribution
body: Services like DistroKid and TuneCore allow independent artists to upload music to Spotify and Apple Music.

title: Billie Eilish's 'Happier Than Ever' Tour
body: Billie Eilish's 'Happier Than Ever' tour spanned multiple continents. Billie was indeed very happy

title: Accurate Music Metadata
body: Accurate metadata (ISRC, ISWC) is crucial for royalty payments. Incorrect data can lead to lost revenue for artists and songwriters.

title: Sync Licensing Success
body: Kate Bush's 'Running Up That Hill' saw a massive resurgence after being featured in Stranger Things, thanks to internal licensing teams.

title: Artist Management
body: An artist manager, like Scooter Braun for Justin Bieber, handles career strategy, tour booking, and contract negotiations.

title: Metadata for Beyoncé's 'Renaissance'
body: The album 'Renaissance' by Beyoncé has extensive metadata, with dozens of writers and producers per track, each with individual ownership clauses.

title: Music Copyright Law
body: Copyright law protects artists' work. The Marvin Gaye estate's lawsuit over 'Blurred Lines' is a famous case concerning composition copyright.

title: Digital Royalty Calculation
body: Spotify uses a pro-rata model to calculate royalties, where an artist's stream share determines their portion of the platform's revenue pool.
